channel.title: Polymorphism on coda.life
channel.description: Recent content in Polymorphism on coda.life

item.title: Poor Man's Polymorphism
item.description: Like c++ without a virtual table, C structs can be casted between each other if the field types and ordering are the same. This is entirely not portable across systems. A Quick Example struct Animal { int eyes; } struct Dog { int eyes; /* dog specific */ int tail; } struct Human{ int key; /* human specific */ int brain; } We can pass humans or dogs to any function that takes an animal.
